result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Harshbarger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 154 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
COMPLY WITH DAY REPORT CENTER FOR 60 DAYS. No Good Time allowed on DRC. If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 90 days Huber Stayed will be permanently stayed.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation. With Huber. STAYED for compliance with Day Report Center.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas R Harshbarger in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Smith.   Timothy Suha and District Attorney's office law intern, Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   (154 Days credit, if revoked)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: HUBER:  90 days -  STAYED -  DAY REPORT CENTER:  60 DAYS.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 90 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 
 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
